text: I'm gonna share something really fun
with you it's a lemon spice Ice Cream
Sandwich and I'd like to say that it's
very reminiscent of that classic Ice
Cream Sandwich that you probably ate
when you were a kid except for that the
cookie itself is a lemon spice cookie
instead of the chocolate but it has that
great texture so that when you bite into
it you get the cookie and ice cream and
nothing squishes around and nothing goes
flying all over the place you can make
it plain actually if you don't like the
spice you can leave out the spices but I
kind of like it quarter teaspoon of
cinnamon goes into three quarters of cup
of all-purpose flour along with a
quarter teaspoon of ground ginger 1/2
teaspoon of coarse salt whisk that
together you're making a very very thin
cake which is actually standing in for
the cookie did that add 3/4 of a cup of
sugar a tablespoon of molasses just for
a hint of that richness that you get
from molasses you could probably use a
tablespoon of dark brown sugar but I
like this molasses here and maybe it
helps with the texture I'm not totally
sure that I can say that with any
confidence though one stick of unsalted
butter melted whisk it into the dry
ingredients and then two eggs
there's no lebanon here it's that simple
all together in a bowl have your oven
preheating to 350 degrees no need to pre
whisk none of that my kind of cookie
cake whatever you'll see it's kind of
not it's like cookie Fitness and cake
texture a teaspoon of grated lemon zest
when you're using the zest of citrus
it's a good idea no matter what you're
using scrub it really well to remove any
wax from the outside that can go right
in and then it's 2 tablespoons of the
lemon juice I get a lot of Tang from the
lemon juice which is nice it gives a
really great brightness to this cookie
two tablespoons one
- nope whisk and then this is a 10 by 15
inch rimmed baking sheet and it's been
brushed with butter and lined with
parchment spread your batter evenly into
the pan it's gonna be very thin and
that's exactly what you're looking for
if you're having a party these aren't
great to make because they're completely
make-ahead obviously because they're ice
cream sandwiches they have to go into
the freezer and everybody loves an Ice
Cream Sandwich and you could put
different flavors of ice cream in them
all kinds of stuff get this into the
oven 350 until it's dry to the touch and
just pulling away slightly from the
edges that'll take 12 to 14 minutes okay
so my cake has cooled I took it out of
the pan and you just lift it out then
what you want to do is cut it in half
and then turn one piece top side down
that's where you gonna put your ice
cream now for the ice cream you can fill
it with whatever flavors you like some
of my favorites for this particular
flavor of cake
are strawberry which is what I'm using
today a swirl of vanilla and some kind
of citrusy sorbet is really nice like a
mandarin sorbet and vanaya ice cream or
actually really fantastic and kind of
unique coffee ice cream is really good
in here okay
put the ice cream should be slightly
softened but not melty and put it into a
mixer you can probably do this with a
spatula if you have a mixer it's really
the best thing because it works really
quickly in your ice cream doesn't get
melted but it gets softened and pliable
a great use for your standing mixer
that's it don't overdo it
I've ever told you how much I love ice
cream ever since I read in farmer boy by
Laura Ingalls Wilder with one of those
books and they made ice cream and they
turned it and everybody had to take a
turn turning the things he had to do it
by hand I was obsessed with ice cream
and it's laughs didn't my whole life
spread the ice cream evenly to the edges
it's like about a little over an inch
thick you want it completely to the
edges so don't worry if it squishes out
a little bit when you wrap it up because
you want to make sure that even the
people who get the edge pieces get ice
cream but you don't want to lose too
much for your ice cream so that looks
really fantastic put the other piece of
cake right on top press it down so it's
even and then you want to wrap it up in
the plastic wrap and then get it into
the freezer you're gonna want to be
tempted to take this out and slice it
soon but in order for it to be the
really good slice and consistency I find
that it takes about eight hours so make
this the day before you want to eat it
you can leave it in there firm a long
time as long as the it's well wrapped
you can leave it in there week two weeks
even a month get it in freezer eight
hours okay here it is here it is the big
reveal probably want to take it off the
plastic wrap you can see some dead news
out the sides that's totally cool if you
use a serrated knife on this it should
cut through really really really easily
even though I just took this out of the
freezer I can slice through it which is
what's so great about this cookie not
hard but it's not too soft cut it in
half lengthwise I mean really at this
point you can cut it into whatever sizes
you want say you want like little Ice
Cream Sandwich bites you could do that
cut them into like 1-inch pieces I like
them in bars though sort of to emulate
that classic shape so I just cut mine
into bars like that there you go see
